content: I can't quite tell what's up with wg-async-foundations#85 -- there's been some amount of conversation, but I think it is roughly "as the author wants" it at this point -- @Johnathan Van Why did you have any further work you planned to do?
There's a lot of interesting info in the comments, and I think maybe it'd be nice to move that stuff to FAQs, if you were up for that
(They could even just link to the PR, in the limit)
I did not have any further work planned, no.
I'll look through the PR comments and see if it makes sense to move anything into the FAQ.
@Johnathan Van Why thanks! let me know

I found a few things that might make sense in the FAQ:

  1. A clarification on nice-to-have versus deal-breaker. Future has a lot of nice-to-haves but 1 deal-breaker.
  2. @rylev asked if the code size tradeoffs are fundamental to Future, and I answered in the comments, but not in the doc.
  3. I described how using the term "zero cost" to describes future may be misleading (https://github.com/rust-lang/wg-async-foundations/pull/85#discussion_r600884204)
  4. I could elaborate on Tock's unique userspace thread-safety situation (namely, that there is only 1 thread, and no signals/interrupts)
I think those would be great additions, yes
Okay, I guess I'll add them all :-). I'll try to get that done today but it may be tricky.
